definition: to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid

sentences.chinese: 一個大型參聖奈特提箱，深藍色的。

sentences.english: I inquired about how many suitcases I would be allowed to bring and what the living accommodations would be.
sentences.chinese: 我詢問我可以帶多少個手提箱，食宿條件如何。

sentences.english: Everything in my suitcase was jumbled together.
sentences.chinese: 我手提箱裏的一切都混在一起了。

sentences.english: She reached down, picked up a suitcase, and put it back in the van.
sentences.chinese: 她彎下腰，拎起一個手提箱放回貨車裏。

sentences.english: A suitcase is enough to take your clothes with you on holiday.
sentences.chinese: 一隻手提箱足夠裝得下度假時替換的衣服。

sentences.english: TOMMY: Ken, you get the first run of counterfeit cash TOMMY: and put three mil in briefcases.
sentences.chinese: 肯，你先去準備假鈔，然後放個三百萬到手提箱內。

sentences.english: This one was dressed in a suit and carried a small suitcase.
sentences.chinese: 那人穿着西裝，手裏還提着個小提箱。

sentences.english: He had left his case on the 4∶40 train.
sentences.chinese: 他把手提箱丟在4點40分的火車上了。

sentences.english: Oh, can I keep this little suitcase as hand-luggage?
sentences.chinese: 哦，那我可以把這個小手提箱隨身攜帶嗎？

sentences.english: Okole gave him a suitcase and promised to follow on the next flight.
sentences.chinese: Okole給他一個手提箱，並保證乘下一航班跟來。

sentences.english: This size of the suitcase is perfect for 2-day tour.
sentences.chinese: 這種大小的手提箱最適合用在兩天一夜的旅行。
耙標籤粘鐵在你的手提箱上。

sentences.english: A knob-shaped handle for opening and closing a door.
sentences.chinese: 他把手提箱從這隻手換到另一隻手。

sentences.english: One of my suitcases hasn’t come out yet.
sentences.chinese: 我還有一個手提箱沒出來。

sentences.english: The girl was encumbered with a suitcase and several packages.
sentences.chinese: 那位姑娘爲一個小提箱和幾個包裹所累。
